info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 4 at 7:57PM CDT until June 6 at 10:20AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
James River near Boaz affecting Christian and Stone Counties.
For the James River...including Boaz...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...James River near Boaz.
* WHEN...From late tonight to late Friday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Low lying areas near the river flood. Flows may be dangerous for canoers.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 7.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 10.5 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on 05/16/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Thursday evening at 800 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE FRIDAY MORNING
